resources.string: Allow %1$s to show slices from any app

"You’re ready to start using your phone.
You can turn off gesture navigation and use buttons to go back, home and switch apps. "Go to Settings
Thanks for the feedback. This will help inform future tips.
To see videos and images, try connecting to Wi-Fi or switching networks
Internet connection needed to show videos and images
Switch apps, change settings quickly, focus better and more
Find apps, get around your phone and more
Switched from iPhoneⓇ? Find apps, get around your phone and more
Talk to your Assistant, identify music with Now Playing and more
Take beautiful portraits, swipe between modes and more
Send images, make video calls and share photos
Quickly open camera, check notifications and more
Track your screen time, set a schedule to disconnect and more
See two apps at once, organise apps with folders and more
Take notes, pay with Pixel and get the latest news coverage
Video about the new gesture to go back
To go back to the last screen, swipe towards the middle from the left or right edge
Video about the new gesture to go home
"Swipe up from the bottom of your screen. This gesture always takes you to the Home screen."
Video about the new gesture for overview
Swipe up from the bottom of your screen and hold
Make the most of Pixel. Watch videos and more.
Take portraits, get the perfect shot and more
Send images, make video calls and more
Check notifications, open camera and more
Talk to your Google Assistant and more
Swipe up from the bottom of your screen to see your recent apps. You’ll also see a row of predicted apps at the bottom. Swipe up again to see all of your apps.

"To add an app to your Home screen, touch and drag the app.
To remove an app, touch and hold the app, then drag it towards the top of your screen."
"Get started with these apps: – Play Store: Explore and download apps – Google Photos: Find, save and share photos – Google Keep: Capture notes, lists and more"

"Swipe down from the top of your screen to see notifications. To clear a notification, swipe it left or right.
To see more info about a notification, touch and hold it."

"Swipe down from the top of your Pixel to open Quick Settings. Swipe down again for more settings.
To turn a setting on or off, tap it. To see more options for a setting, touch & hold it."

"If you’re using your phone but want to stay focused, you can stop notifications from appearing.
Explore new controls in Do Not Disturb."
Focus better with Do Not Disturb

"Touch & hold text to see available actions, such as making a restaurant reservation.
You can do this from any app. It even works when you’re switching between apps."

"More tips and support are available at any time. Just go to Settings > Tips & support.
You can explore tips, browse help articles or contact the Pixel team."
Get help when you need it
To turn this feature on, tap the button below.
To turn this feature on, tap the button below.
Video on squeezing for your Assistant
To talk to your Google Assistant at any time (even when the screen is off), quickly squeeze the bottom half of your phone, then release.

"Your Google Assistant is the fast and easy way to find answers and get things done on your Pixel.
To talk to your Assistant, quickly squeeze the bottom half of your phone, then release and say:
– \"When’s my first event tomorrow?\" – \"Add toothpaste to my shopping list\" – \"Let’s go home\""
Discover what your Assistant can do
Video about searching with Google Lens

"See a cute animal, unique plant or impressive landmark that catches your eye? Use Google Lens to learn more.
Just open up your Camera, touch & hold in the viewfinder, then tap the item that you’re interested in."
Search what you see with Google Lens
To use Now Playing, update Pixel Ambient Services.
To turn this feature on, tap the button below.
Now Playing automatically displays song info for whatever song is playing, wherever you are.
Your Pixel automatically recognises phone numbers, addresses, emails, barcodes and QR codes. Just open your camera, point, and let your camera do the work.

"Sometimes you want to shoot a photo, then a video, then something a little different.
To switch between modes, just open the Camera viewfinder and swipe left or right. Tap More for other options."
Swipe between photo, video and more

"In Portrait mode, Pixel blurs the background for a beautiful, professional look. Try it and see for yourself.
Just open your Camera, swipe from left to right, and you’re ready to go."

"Press & hold the power button, then tap Screenshot. Presto, you’ve just snapped a screenshot.
To draw on the screenshot, tap Edit in the notification that appears."
Video about picking the perfect moment with Top Shot

"Every time that you take a photo, Pixel saves an extra image or two so you can get the perfect shot.
1. Make sure Motion [icon_span] is turned on, then take your photo 2. When you’re viewing the photo, just swipe up from the bottom 3. Tap 'Shots in this photo' to review alternative images"
Pick the perfect moment with Top Shot
Video about taking a group selfie

"Group Selfie gives you more room in your photo for friends or scenery – no selfie stick required.
1. Switch to the front-facing camera [icon_span] 2. Double-tap the screen or pinch your fingers closed to zoom out"
"1. Open a conversation in the Messages app 2. Tap Compose [icon_span] to the left of where you type your message 3. Select the perfect image, emoji or sticker"

"Nothing beats a face-to-face chat with your closest friends & family. That’s why Pixel makes video calling easy with Google Duo.
1. Open the Google Duo app 2. Search for a contact 3. Start a video call with one tap, or invite them to download Google Duo
Your friends on iOSⓇ phones and tablets can use Google Duo too."
Make video calls with Google Duo
"1. Open Google Photos 2. Touch & hold to select an image 3. Select multiple images, if you’d like 4. Tap Share [icon_span] 5. Select people to share with"
Video about texting from your computer

"You can text from your computer using Android Messages. To get started, go to your Messages app and select 'Messages for web' in the menu.
In addition to texting, you can send stickers, emoji and attach images."
You can check the time, notifications and more by double-tapping your screen.
Press the power button twice from any screen to switch to your camera in a flash.
Video about switching to portrait mode
To switch in and out of selfie mode in your camera, double-twist when you’re in the app.
Video about swiping fingerprint for notifications
"You can check your notifications by swiping down on the fingerprint sensor on the back of your phone. Swipe again to see Quick Settings."
To quickly switch apps, scroll from left to right on the bottom of the screen. Release to open the app.

"Night Light tints your screen amber. This makes it easier to look at your screen or read in dim light, and may help you fall asleep more easily.
You can quickly turn Night Light on or off in Quick Settings. Or just touch & hold to set up a schedule."
Fall asleep more easily with Night Light
Video about setting a bedtime schedule with Wind Down

"Set up a nightly schedule to disconnect from your phone.
1. Open Digital Wellbeing [icon_span] 2. Tap Wind Down 3. Set up your Wind Down schedule
When it’s almost time for bed, your screen will change colour, and Do Not Disturb will prevent notifications from interrupting your sleep."
Set a bedtime schedule with Wind Down
With flip to Shhh, simply place your phone face down to turn on Do Not Disturb and stop notifications and sounds.
Check out the Digital Wellbeing dashboard in Settings for a snapshot of your screen time, and set timers for apps that you’d like to use less.
Keep track of your screen time
Video about organising apps with folders

"Create folders to easily keep track of your apps.
To create a folder, drag an app on top of another app. You can name the new folder.
You can drag more apps into the folder, or drag an app out to remove it."
Video about using 2 apps at once

"You can use two apps at the same time by setting up split screen on your phone. Let the multitasking begin.
1. Swipe up from the bottom of your screen to see your recent apps 2. Touch & hold the app icon at the top of the screen 3. Tap Split screen
Move the divider up and down as needed. Swipe it away once you’ve finished."
See two apps at the same time
Video about controlling phone with Assistant

"Your Assistant can help you take actions faster. To talk to your Assistant, quickly squeeze the bottom half of your phone. Then try saying:
1. \"Take a selfie\" 2. \"Take a screenshot\" 3. \"Turn on torch\""
Use your Google Assistant for help with everyday tasks

"With the Google Keep app, you can quickly capture what’s on your mind. Add notes, lists, photos and audio.
You can also set reminders so that you remember to finish your tasks. And Keep makes it easy to share notes with friends and family."
Take notes and more with Google Keep

"Get top coverage on breaking, local and global news.
With just a tap, see top headlines from your favourite sources. You’ll see a timeline of key moments, opinions, analysis and more to help you understand the story a layer deeper."
Stay up to date with Google News

"Google Pay is the speedy way to pay in millions of shops using just your Pixel phone. Here’s how:
1. Add a card to Google Pay 2. Look for the contactless symbol [icon_span] at the checkout 3. Unlock your phone and hold it near the terminal 4. Wait until you see a tick mark
That’s it!"
Video for using new accessibility gesture

"To access Select to Speak or magnification, swipe up from the bottom of the screen with two fingers.
To switch between accessibility apps, swipe up with two fingers and hold.
You can use these gestures after you finish setup."
Check back later for new tips
